main event: A large white streak of light was observed falling through the sky southwest of Wichita Falls, Texas, on 28 September 1960.
interesting points: The sighting duration varied from 5 seconds to 30-35 seconds,Many witnesses observed the brilliant light describe it as a classic meteor or fireball,One witness managed to catch a piece of material that was rubber-like in quality before it disintegrated,The absence of noise during the sighting led investigators to dismiss the possibility of it being an aircraft,Multiple reports suggested the object fell approximately 30 miles southwest of the initial observation point.
witness description: Witnesses included military personnel, police officers, and local civilians of varying ages.
